citation.name: Nature
citation.title: Structure and allosteric inhibition of excitatory amino acid transporter 1.

comment.text: Sodium-dependent amino acids transporter that has a broad substrate specificity, with a preference for zwitterionic amino acids. It accepts as substrates all neutral amino acids, including glutamine, asparagine, and branched-chain and aromatic amino acids, and excludes methylated, anionic, and cationic amino acids (PubMed:8702519). Through binding of the fusogenic protein syncytin-1/ERVW-1 may mediate trophoblasts syncytialization, the spontaneous fusion of their plasma membranes, an essential process in placental development (PubMed:10708449, PubMed:23492904).
(Microbial infection) Acts as a cell surface receptor for feline endogenous virus RD114, baboon M7 endogenous virus and type D simian retroviruses.
Homotrimer (Probable). Interacts with ERVH48-1/suppressyn; may negatively regulate syncytialization (PubMed:23492904).
Identified by mass spectrometry in melanosome fractions from stage I to stage IV.
A number of isoforms are produced by alternative initiation. Isoforms start at multiple alternative CUG and GUG codons.
Placenta, lung, skeletal muscle, kidney, pancreas, and intestine.
Belongs to the dicarboxylate/amino acid:cation symporter (DAACS) (TC 2.A.23) family. SLC1A5 subfamily.

property.value: the dicarboxylate/amino acid:cation (na(+) or h(+)) symporter (daacs) family
Amino acid transport across the plasma membrane
F:neutral amino acid transmembrane transporter activity

entry.keyword: Host cell receptor for virus entry
